intro: Lichtensteinia beiliana var. simplicior, commonly known as the simple-leaved lichensteinia, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It is characterized by its small, succulent leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette formation. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
